articles.title: Frank Gehry, who stretched architecture’s boundaries, dies at 96 - The Washington Post
articles.description: His unearthly but brilliant designs, from Los Angeles to Bilbao, became global landmarks.

articles.title: Oscars TV Rights Auction Heats Up: Netflix Out and NBCUniversal Is Ahead as ABC Holds the Line (EXCLUSIVE) - Variety
articles.description: NBCUniversal is in the lead to nab TV rights to the Oscars starting in 2029 as the Motion Picture Academy shops around for a new deal.

articles.title: Theater Owners Worry Netflix Buying Warner Bros. Will Cripple Their Business: ‘Hopefully the Deal Gets Killed’ - Variety
articles.description: Theater owners and filmmakers worry the sale of Warner Bros. to Netflix will cripple their business and leave them with fewer films to show.

articles.title: Meghan reaches out to estranged father after amputation reports, spokesman says - BBC
articles.description: Thomas Markle is reported to be seriously ill in hospital in the Philippines.

articles.title: The Best Music of 2025, According to Pitchfork Readers - Pitchfork
articles.description: Featuring your picks for the best albums and songs of the year

articles.title: Pluribus turns a ‘caloric deficit’ into a nightmare - The Verge
articles.description: A recap of episode 6 of Pluribus, the new sci-fi series streaming on Apple TV.

articles.title: At least 4 countries pull out of 2026 Eurovision contest over Israel’s participation - NPR
articles.description: Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia said they were pulling out of the contest after organizers decided to allow Israel to continue to compete, despite tensions over its conduct in Gaza.
